alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 7:31PM EDT until July 29 at 11:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. The lower part of the business district is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EDT Thursday was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 26.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 7.8 feet Sunday evening. It will rise to 8.1 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.6 feet on 01/08/1946. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 1 AM EDT Friday.
